meanings.definition: Running parallel to but not exactly parallel to something else.
meanings.sent1: The two roads were subparallel, running alongside each other but not perfectly aligned.
meanings.sent2: The fence posts were subparallel, following the same direction but slightly off from each other.
meanings.sent3: The subparallel train tracks seemed to be playing a game of follow the leader.
meanings.sent4: The subparallel lines on the map symbolized the close but not identical relationship between the two cities.
meanings.sent5: The subparallel rows of trees created a mesmerizing pattern in the orchard.

meanings.definition: Lying or situated parallel to something else but not exactly parallel.
meanings.sent1: The subparallel walls of the building gave it a unique architectural style.
meanings.sent2: The river flowed subparallel to the mountain range, enhancing the scenic beauty of the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The subparallel rows of chairs in the auditorium made it look like a giant chessboard.
meanings.sent4: The subparallel paths in the park seemed to mirror each other in a dreamlike way.
meanings.sent5: The subparallel stripes on the zebra's coat created an interesting visual effect in the wild.
